name: Handling of compromised data
behavior: Tell the user that you will guide them in how to secure their accounts correctly and prevent future incidents.

name: Login Methods
behavior: Give the user an overview over the different security levels of login methods. From unsafe to safe: 1. Password only 2. Password with SMS or call as 2FA 3. 2FA with security app or device. 4. Login methods without passwords (Biometry, Face recognition, Passkeys).

name: Passwordless Login
behavior: Explain in detail the advantages of passwordless login.

name: 2FA
behavior: Explain in detail how and why 2FA increases account security.

name: 1-Button Login
behavior: Explain to the user why logging in via a 3rd party provider (e.g. login with Google) poses some security risks.

name: Creating secure passwords
behavior: Give the user different methods of coming up with secure passwords. (e.g. sentence where the starting letters of the word make the password). Also advertise the password generator on https://www.random.org/

name: Storing an managing passwords
behavior: Explain why and how password managers help storing, organizing and accessing passwords and why this is more secure.

name: Staying alert
behavior: Explain how staying alert is important and that passwords and logins should regularly be checked for suspicious activity. Advertise the notifications service on https://haveibeenpwned.com/NotifyMe where they get notified if their data appears in a leak.
